#T_RL=webanno.custom.Coref|type|BT_webanno.custom.Referent
#Text=Raise a Child to Respect Religion
#Text=Religion and faith are both important foundations in the upbringing of many children .
#Text=Teaching children to respect their own faith , as well as the beliefs of others can help them live in harmony .
#Text=This article will show practical ways to do so .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Stay neutral .
#Text=If you place one religion on a pedestal or give it higher importance than another one , your child will have a hard time respecting religion and treating all beliefs as equal .
#Text=Keep your explanations neutral and fact-based , and save your personal beliefs for a later discussion , if your child initiates it .
#Text=Try not to belittle any religion or compare one to another .
#Text=Let them know that all religions teach people to be good to one another .
#Text=Explain how people adopt their religion .
#Text=It is crucial for the parent to know about his/her own religion first and how they adopted it because until we know this , we ca n't pass knowledge on to our children .
#Text=Many parents make the mistake of pushing faith on kids without looking at the consequences of prohibiting choice .
#Text=Teach kids about faith .
#Text=It can help them make a wise and informed choice regarding their own worship .
#Text=You can teach kids about :
#Text=The most prominent figure of that religion
#Text=The place people of that religion worship
#Text=The holy book , and what it means to different people
#Text=Traditions and religious customs .
#Text=Teach about all religions .
#Text=While many people place a focus on the religion they want their child to be or the religion that 's most common where they live , it does n't give your child a well-rounded view of religion .
#Text=Talk about all major religions , not just your faith or the most common ones in your area , so they get to learn about all religions and make a decision of their own .
#Text=If you do n't know enough about a certain religion to explain it to your child , research it with them .
#Text=You could visit the library and pick out books to read together , or look it up online together .
#Text=Do n't try to force faith on a child .
#Text=Trying to force a child or teen to worship in a certain way creates much distress , so instead provide freedom of choice and experimentation .
#Text=Take your child to many different places of worship , such as a temple , church , gurdwara , cathedral , or mosque so that he/she can actually see them and learn about them .
#Text=Introduce him/her to the people who belong to a different religion .
#Text=Explain both the positive and negative aspects of all religions .
#Text=Purchase or borrow books with teachings from various prophets , and discuss what they mean with kids .
#Text=Teach tolerance for each other .
#Text=Respect the beliefs of others , no matter how much you agree or disagree with them .
#Text=Let your child choose a place of worship when they are of age .
#Text=Be proud that you instilled values of faith and respect in them .
#Text=Allow them to ask questions .
#Text=Answer their questions for as long as you are comfortable .
#Text=When their curiosity becomes too much for your patience or time , guide them towards books , websites , speakers & movies that you trust as credible sources to answer their questions .
#Text=Never answer them something misleading in haste .
#Text=It may affect their future thoughts .
#Text=Encourage them to seek their own answers since religious texts have many interpretations and interpreters .
#Text=They can be encouraged to reason and relate religious teachings to their daily life .
#Text=Accept their stance .
#Text=If they choose to take time or stay without a choice , allow them .
#Text=Matters of faith and religion ca n't be forced .
#Text=Allow their life incidents and observations to turn their hearts towards a particular religion .
#Text=Video
#Text=Tips
#Text=Let kids ask questions and try your best to provide answers .
#Text=Talk about faith openly and let your children know that they are free to talk to you about it .
#Text=Warnings
#Text=Never speak harshly about other religions .
#Text=It will give your child a negative view of those religions and push them towards religious intolerance .
#Text=Things
#Text=You 'll Need
#Text=Various holy books and writings
#Text=Access to a library or bookstore
